election_record.label: North Carolina 1824 State Senate, Hertford County

overview.note: "The election in Hertford county, it appears, was closely contested: the succesful candidate for the Senate received 151 votes; the other, 127. Now how many counties are there in the west, that give from twelve to fifteen hundred senate votes? Yet Hertford has equal weight in the General Assembly with the largest county in the state! This is equality and Republicanism, for ye!!" Western Carolinian (Salisbury, NC). September 14, 1824.
The Star, and North-Carolina State Gazette (Raleigh, NC) and the Raleigh Register, and North-Carolina State Gazette (Raleigh, NC) list Jas. Copeland with 157 votes and D. E. Sumner with 126 votes.

election_record.reference: Raleigh Register, and North-Carolina State Gazette (Raleigh, NC). August 24, 1824.
